channel.title: Felicia Huang's Website
channel.description: Recent content on Felicia Huang's Website

item.title: Assessing the supply and demand of Singapore's attractions using Tripadvisor data
item.description: Most work on big data for tourism analytics only considers the demand indicators of a city’s attractions. This project aims for a novel data-driven analysis that considers both supply and demand indicators when assessing a city’s attractions. Understanding not only what creates demand, but also where supply-demand mismatch exists is crucial for a city to improve its attractiveness.

item.title: Sensing Community Resilience from COVID-19 Using Social Media
item.description: This project discovers social media use and community resilience development during the COVID-19 pandemic in Singapore. Particularly, Singaporean attitudes and sentiments and the roles that social media fulfils in supporting community resilience during a pandemic. The results of the analysis shows that Twitter is not used very often as a tool for grass root collaborative problem-solving, but more often as a tool to coordinate top-down community response and promote connectedness. Geo-tagged data analysis suggests that different regional characteristics do not lead to difference in community resilience efforts across Singapore.

item.title: AI in Urban Health: Lifelogging
item.description: This project employs lifelogging to understand neighbourhood walkability of the Tampines Town in Singapore. Lifelogging is a method that explores travel pattern and its association with built environment features in real time. Three lifelogging data is used: lifelogging images, locations, and diary. Different tools are used to capture this data: a small wearable camera, a gps tracker, and a travel diary. Photo:newatlas.com. Wearable Camera

item.title: AI in Urban Health: Participatory GIS Resident Survey
item.description: This project uses a Participatory GIS Resident Survey tool, Maptionnaire, to understand neighbourhood walkability of the Tampines Town in Singapore. Unlike a typical survey tool, Participatory GIS survey incorporates GIS functionality into the survey questions, enabling participants to mark a route, a place, or an area of interest. Marking a Place Marking a Route Marking an Area

item.title: I Won a Notebook
item.description: Last weekend, in a cursive workshop by the russian language centre, I won a notebook for the best handwriting. I’m glad :). I will put this notebook to good use. My Handwriting The Notebook I Won. The Cover Reads From Petersburg with Apathy and Indifference

item.title: I Won a Notebook
item.description: Last weekend, in a cursive workshop by the russian language centre, I won a notebook for the best handwriting. I’m glad :). I will put this notebook to good use. My Handwriting The Notebook I Won. The Cover Reads From Petersburg with Apathy and Indifference

item.title: Saya Menang Hadiah Buku Tulis
item.description: Akhir pekan kemarin, di kelas menulis indah yang diselenggarakan oleh Institut Bahasa Rusia, saya memenangkan buku tulis untuk tulisan terbaik. Saya senang sekali :). Tentunya, buku tulis ini akan saya gunakan sebaik-baiknya. Tulisan Tangan Saya Buku Catatan yang Saya Menangkan. Di Sampulnya Tertulis Dari Petersburg dengan Tak Acuh dan Tak Peduli

item.title: 我赢了笔记本
item.description: 上个星期, 在俄语言中心进行的草写作坊, 因为字写得很漂亮，我赢得了笔记本. 我非常开心 :). 我将好好利用它. 我的笔迹 我赢得的笔记本. 封面上写着 来自圣彼得堡，带着无动于衷与冷漠

item.title: Я Выиграла Блокнот
item.description: В прошлые выходные, на практике рукописного письма в Центре Русского Языка, я выиграла блокнот за самый красивый почерк. Я очень рада :). Я ему найду хорошее применение. Мой Почерк Блокнот, Который Выиграла Я
